poem:
"Amidst the Shambles"

Ushers in gowns wield unseen scales,
Justice held hostage to a council's wails.
With every judgement, honour frail,
A nation's trust on slippery trails.
Yet, in the common man prevails,
A strength unseen that never quails.
Expose the tarnished, lift the veils -
For truth and justice, no deceit entails.
